Issues.Title: [RC2/9.0] Backport analyzer for InvokeAsync guidance (11969)
Issues.Body:
Backport #11969.

## Customer Impact

With the new `Control.InvokeAsync` API, we identified that there is additional guidance needed, to avoid introducing stability issues, when using sync intended delegates with async return types like `Task` or `ValueTask`.

More details at #11945.

## Workaround: Doesn't apply.

## Regression?
- [ ] Yes from the previous release
- [X] No
 
## Risk
- [ ] High
- [ ] Medium
- [X] Low –The changes are isolated and are not affecting anything else.

## Verification
- [X] Manual testing – Several manual tests made sure the correct functionality.
- [X] Automated - the Analyzer has dedicated unit tests.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11976)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[RC2/9.0] Backport analyzer for InvokeAsync guidance (11969)" (#11976)

Issues.Title: Add Analyzer for InvokeAsync guidance to avoid stability issues
Issues.Body:
Fixes #11945. 
Both for C# and Visual Basic.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/24fc0c6b-1504-49f3-bd7e-49400750b458)

Issues.Title: Before Designer display my form, it keeps throwing a lot of these windows
Issues.Body: ### Environment Version 17.11.0 ### .NET version .Net 6 ### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release? Before 17.11.0, those screens didn't appear. ### Issue description During the form loading on Designer, it keeps messaging me via popups it's internal log like in these images: Is there a way to disable this "Windows Forms Trace Listener"? I tried to configure Logging to None on Visual Studio settings, but I don't get any result ### Steps to reproduce Open a form in designer mode. During initialization, designer keeps throwing debug messages into a "Windows Forms Trace Listener" popup window. ### Diagnostics _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Before Designer display my form, it keeps throwing a lot of these windows" (#11975)

Issues.Title: #11971 Enhance WinForms Application static class to get current application context
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #11971

## Proposed changes

- Add a new public static method on Application: GetCurrentApplicationContext()

## Customer Impact

- A new public API

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- No clearly risk

## Test methodology

- Can get current application context from another thread
- Can get current application context from another thread with a message loop

## Test environment(s)

- 9.0.100-preview.7.24407.12

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11972)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] ListViewGroup/Subtitle/TaskLink is hard to visible in ListView after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-rc.1.24418.2 + private dlls built from winforms repo main branch

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This is a new feature Dark Mode: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11857

### Issue description

ListViewGroup/Subtitle/TaskLink is hard to visible in ListView after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/10af8375-455a-47c1-83e7-62516f3b6809)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET application with ListView control
2. Add ListViewItem, ListViewColumn, ListViewGroup with setting Subtitle/TaskLink property
3. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file
4. Run the application to observe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dark Mode] ListViewGroup/Subtitle/TaskLink is hard to visible in ListView after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark" (#11965)

Issues.Title: Make the toolbar menu items support the support space key
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #11449


## Proposed changes

- Modify the ProcessCmdKey() method to support space key.
- Make a focus on the MenuStrip after the user hits enter to check it.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- MenuItems does not respond to the spacebar key to check/uncheck the menu and enter key executes it and closes the menu 
   without focus the menustrip.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 9.0.100-preview.7.24407.12

Issues.Title: Fix Setting DataGridViewImageCell.ImageLayout to NotSet
Issues.Body:
Fixes #11927

This regressed due to some property store work in .NET 10. `PropertyStore.AddOrRemoveValue` will remove the value from the property store if the value is the default value. 
When setting `DataGridViewImageCell.ImageLayout` we cannot remove the value in the property store even if the value being set is the default because our getter for ImageLayout had always returned `DataGridViewImageCellLayout.Normal` if the property had not been set, not the default value, which is `DataGridViewImageCellLayout.NotSet`. This means with the current code if the user sets the ImageLayout to `DataGridViewImageCellLayout.NotSet`, when retrieving ImageLayout we will receive `DataGridViewImageCellLayout.Normal` instead, which is not expected. 
Updated the code to never remove the property store value for ImageLayout. It will only update the value.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11961)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix Setting DataGridViewImageCell.ImageLayout to NotSet" (#11961)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] CheckBox in TreeView/ListView is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-rc.1.24418.2 + private dlls built from winforms repo main branch

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This is a new feature Dark Mode: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11857

### Issue description

CheckBox in TreeView/ListView is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark, which should be same as the checkBox in CheckBox/CheckedListBox control
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e9b4bd2d-d47f-419f-91fa-b8bebc61908b)



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET application with TreeView/ListView control
2. Set **CheckBoxes** property to true for TreeView/ListView, then add some items for them
3. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file
4. Run application to observe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dark Mode] CheckBox in TreeView/ListView is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark" (#11956)

Issues.Title: [Dark Mode] ToolTip is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-rc.1.24418.2 + private dlls built from winforms repo main branch

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This is a new feature Dark Mode: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11857

### Issue description

ToolTip is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ea50b080-3745-4cdf-becf-de2ebe4427e9)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET application with checkBox and toolTip controls
2. Find the **ToolTip on toolTip1** property of checkBox, then set some text for this property
3. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file
4. Run application, tab or mouse over this checkBox to observe the keyboard tooltip or mouse tooltip
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dark Mode] ToolTip is not in dark mode after enabled SystemColorMode.Dark" (#11954)

Run the application to observe

Issues.Title: Moving Clipboard related tests to a new class under collection Sequential
Issues.Body:
Moving the tests that use Clipboard to OriginalFileName.ClipboardTests.cs and [Collection("Sequential")] for it, like PR #11606

**Under Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Tests:**

- [ ] ComputerTests.cs
- [x] ClipboardProxyTests.cs

**Under System.Windows.Forms.Tests:**

- [x] ClipboardComTests.cs 
- [x] ClipboardTests.cs 
- [x] TextBoxBaseTests.ClipboardTests.cs 
- [x] RichTextBoxTests.ClipboardTests.cs   #11936
- [x] DataFormatsTests.cs  #11970 
- [x] DataGridViewCellTests.cs  #11936
- [x] DataObjectTests.cs #11970
- [x] DragDropFormatTests.cs  #11970
